snippet: The State Water Resources Control Board voted 5 to 0 to adopt sweeping restrictions on how people, governments and businesses can use water amid the state’s four-year drought.
abstract: California's Water Resources Control Board unanimously approves further significant restrictions on water use for residents, governments and businesses as four-year drought continues.
lead_paragraph: The State Water Resources Control Board voted 5 to 0 to adopt sweeping restrictions on how people, governments and businesses can use water amid the state’s four-year drought.

headline.main: California: Regulators Approve Mandatory Water Restrictions
